bow: are you able to cook while alone with an older baby toddler my son is months old so when say older babies generally mean pretty active and at least semi mobile you ca really just stick them in bouncy seat or carrier for long periods anymore my husband and both work jobs so usually at the end of the day he ll watch the baby while make dinner but sometimes he works late and like to get dinner started at the usual time but really do know how to accomplish this our kitchen is really closed off from the rest of the house so ca keep an eye on him if he playing in another room he not quite crawling yet but he rolls and scoots enough to get into trouble if we re not nearby the kitchen is also really cramped so there not really any place to put him on the floor in there can put him in an exersaucer in the kitchen but he ll get bored with that before long same with high chair can give him some puffs to munch on but again this only holds interest for so long before he screams to get down keeping him restrained in something for the entire 30 45 minutes it would take me to cook just does seem possible imagine this is just going to get more difficult as he gets more mobile but figure there are plenty of moms who somehow manage to cook dinner while watching the baby so ve come here to ask how there always quick and easy meals like sandwiches or frozen family meals that you do have to spend too much time on or there precooking doing prep work on the days your have your husband to help for example prepare lasagna then freeze when you need it take it out and bake it or even make salad fruit veggies pasta at naptime and serve it for dinner or you can create safe sspace for baby and check on him every five minutes or so baby monitor esp with video attachment may help just ideas good luck try to keep room baby gated that we generally live in during the day that is safe enough to leave the girls for few minutes alone here and there to throw in load of laundry take bathroom break whatever in the first place lived with kids had the large living room baby gated and it worked great the second place had no way to baby gate anything tiny rental townhome including the stairs so did get much cooking done it was too hard to keep the girls safe there our current place ve gated the top of the stairs and that it they have free reign of the whole level but ve got it baby proofed and keep bedroom doors closed when they re not being used back to doing lot more cooking again my girls are yr and 15 mos now my son is two so right now he able to play in the play room on his own while cook sometimes ll have him help me hand me things and such when he was younger he loved going through cabinets so made one that had no child lock on it and filled it with plastic ware that entertained him for about 15 20 minutes then throw some puffs his way to eke out 10 more minutes baby carrier it beating on your shoulders and back though we left one cabinet unlocked that was free for all we made sure that in that cabinet there were only safe items and things that were fun washcloth wooden spoon etc when my kids were that age the best child occupying toy in the world was the fisher price rainforest jumperoo http www fisher price com en us brands babygear products 38839 it like jolly jumper and an exersaucer rolled into one that thing would entertain them for ages they re expensive but you can usually get one for half price on ebay we have very small house so we created baby friendly space for our girl to play in while we re cooking or doing dishes we bought big baby gate circle thing that we call baby prison toss her in there with some toys and cup of juice and we re good to go now that she older deconstructed it into multiple pieces that we use to section off parts of the house make sure it rear one and not one on the front because that could be dangerous around the stove pregnant not yet mom but when my younger siblings were months to years old and watched them if had to make meal or use the rest room give them loud toy and gate them into baby proof area as long as could hear them play with the toy it was safe to take my eyes off them after the age of two could generally get them to help make the meal with me we had one of these in the play room which the kitchen opens out into so could still see him from the sink stove but he was contained now it blocks off the fireplace bookcases the one we had was the north state superyard generally we ve made our family room the safe place where we can put our son now 21 months if we need to run to the bathroom do laundry cook dinner etc the doorways and staircases are gated the outlets are blocked by furniture and you can see hear it from 80 of the rooms in the house we have an open floor plan at months our son was still content for 10 15 minutes in the activity center or in his high chair other than that slow cooker meals are nice because you prep cook them hours before you need to eat them this what do as well my daughter is 13 months putting plastic stuff toys books etc in the cabinet really keeps her attention for while if that does work or when it stops working then give her some fruit then if all else fails resort to one handed cooking while holding her high chair or bouncer son is almost 10 months ll give him baby silverware or plastic cups plates for him to play with not sure how you feel about your baby watching videos but every evening put on music video for my little one as he sits in his highchair and has snack youtube sesame street channel or dvd on my laptop which entertains him while cook clean fold laundry his favorite right now is cookie monster share it maybe some argue that putting on videos for kids is awful for them but interact with him while he watching ll dance and sing along and seriously sometimes mom needs breather from entertaining the baby this allows it just be careful of doing it for too long at one time baby cage aka pack play just put your lo in there and then pull it close to the kitchen and not baby bjorn those things are terrible on babys hips find carrier like ring sling or ergo beco that keeps their legs perpendicular like they are sitting to their torso not just dangling down you can get these at once upon child for around 25 do the baby silverware dishes not just immediately wind up on the floor ca give mine anything to play with in the high chair without it all being thrown out of his reach in matter of moments lol baby jail saved our lives when my girls were about months old we got the gate enclosure for our house the house had closed off floorplan where could cook and watch them at the same time think they were about 12 months yeah it hits the floor but guess that is when put my year old on pick up duty lol what about snacks just assuming he eating solids at months what about some soft sweet potato and then dessert aka fruit while you are eating use silverware until it gets old then switch to food and then new food when ready to eat pack play my husband was deployed for good chunk of our son first year and that thing is the only way was able to eat bathe and pee ca recommend one highly enough wow you cook meals that require you to attend to the actual act of cooking for the full 30 45 minutes as mother of three where the entire last 12 years of mommyhood ve had to manage kids and cooking at the same time first two dinner was ready by the time the hubby got home last one we split and was single mom my mind is blown my advice is this scale down the complexity of the meals on the nights you re alone with the kiddo you can do hamburger helper fairly easy stir meat check on kid add ingredient go back to kid etc often would cook this with one hand and have the kid on my hip the whole time if you prefer something fairly healthy the biggest loser family cookbook has ton of yummy recipes that require just few ingredients and maybe min cooktime heart that book so so much barely at all she is very clingy and ca bear me to be in the kitchen ve now figured out can one hand cook with her on my hip but at 16 months she heavy also sit her on towel on the draining board we have minuscule kitchen temporarily if need to use two hands she right next to me there and would fall against me rather than on the floor and have to keep up really animated narrative of what doing to console her however sometimes she still howls and have to pick her up think she will start to get better particularly the more involve her but it is really hard also ca safely do certain things with her there spitting oil etc ve given her baby food sachets on many occasions instead of cooked lunch because she literally has not let me cook for her though she prefers cooked food to purees now it seems that many of my friends can make all these elaborate creations but unless cook late at night do have chance loved doing this not only for cooking but for other kitchen chores as well my middle one used to steal the silverware from the dishwasher as was doing dishes and have to chase her around the kitchen to get back spoon or something gah love them so much stick my daughter in playpen with one zillion toys sometimes it works sometimes not that time of day can be tough for us what everyone else said playpen or baby jail the one safe unlocked cabinet thing works wonders too you can also buy something like johnny jump up which worked well for my kiddos as well got ta figure out how to use slow cooker cook and freeze meals ahead of time and just generally get creative maybe use nap time to prep ingredients and defrost stuff get it all ready to go there just no time for full scale meals til later on remember though that this time period in your life is only temporary mama take it easy with my eight month old alternate between putting her on the floor in front of cabinet full of tupperware unbreakables wearing her on my hip in sling so she can watch adjusting her as needed when she tries to grab sharp or hot things wearing her in mei tai front or back carrier where she is less able to grab things but can still watch and be all mellow and chill because she with mama sometimes feed her one handed while using the other hand to stir when she is in front carry have done complex four or five course meals with her in that thing bringing drawer of her toys from the shelving dresser type toy chest in the living room into the kitchen with me if she is bored of the tupperware cupboard my older daughter did not like the drawer full of toys trick the cupboard trick was okay but only occupied her for minutes rather than the good 20 minutes it will keep the younger one occupied so ended up wearing her most of the time that was cooking the other thing did with eldest was that did lot of pre cooking the night before when sitting in front of the tv after they went to bed or just quickly before went to bed would chop my veggies make my sauce or marinade prep the meat and pop it in the fridge so dinner prep the next day would be shorter on days when knew have less time or support the next day plan crockpot meal and do the prep the night before then dump it all in the crockpot in the morning and get home from work to already made stew or curry etc also made double batches of favourites now and then to have freezer backup meals on really exhausted evenings seriously not when lived in the us they were always way overpriced maybe they sell the older models for lot less my husband was deployed for much of my son first three years had to figure out how to cook with baby would distract with snack in high chair or place him in jumperoo and talk to him and sing and make funny faces anything to keep him distracted and happy generally would stick to easy to prepare meals that could just throw together and throw in the oven or crock pot so would have to have him sitting for too long feel ya femalien my son months and ca be distracted for long he also refuses the exersaucer or high chair for more than few minutes at time my best ploy is to gather everything need to chop or prep and bring it my cutting boards and my knife into the living room so right there watching him it takes longer than normal because often have to stop and help him walk around or read him story but eventually get it done either that or bring bunch of toys to the kitchen and sit on the floor with him while do my prep work again he not impressed for long with the toys but it buys me while before have to try another tactic was going to say sesame street too it the only way get the dishwasher emptied in peace you are exactly right sometimes mommy needs breather and elmo gets to take turn with toddler crankypants plan my meals out and do all the prep work when get home from the store so my meats will be trimmed or cut up and put in baggy with marinade if was using some same with veggies all washed and cut and ready to use this saves lot of time in the long run survived having to cook with baby by doing all the prep work on free day then just assemble and cook and would often roast which takes almost no work and you have huge break in between steps *when you get your veggies home peel and chop all of them put into their own containers *when you get your meat home season marinate and store it all in containers *this way when you get home you assemble your parts season and add heat that how cooked all our meals in tiny one bedroom apt for year with the baby at my feet or in her high chair no more than feet from me had this one as well she loved it had several methods depending what sort of mood she was in pack play at kitchen entrance was number one and most easy for me baby in backpack with toy somehow attached with ribbon do she could throw it but it would fall high chair with toys or silverware or food free for all cupboard on floor within her reach so she could pull everything out to play with now she is 16 mo and will set her on the counter next to me and monitor her closely so she does jump off or try to grab something that could hurt her choose simpler meals for the days you have to do it yourself or do most of the prep work before work when you are both there make enough for two meals and freeze part of it do you can just throw it in the oven on another day good luck another baby jail story here we have an open living dining room so we used two baby gate sets to make one big play area can see it from the kitchen and generally he happy to play in there alone while cook also used to do prep work the night before sometimes or during naps so all my ingredients were washed and chopped saving crucial time when getting dinner ready infant too small or too fussy to sit in high chair would be on my back in carrier once old enough to be distracted by opening cupboards leave her on the floor all the lower drawers and cabinets were child friendly things only the cupboard under the sink is locked once my daughter was old enough that she wanted to help set her up on the floor with pot bowl on top of towel with of water and spoon and let her cook she gradually learned to stir gently once she was able to stir without splashing water all over the floor would let her actually stir for me juice eggs pancake batter etc when she was about 18 months give or take we taught her how to use small step ladder safely and that is her favourite spot now she stands up there and stirs things she know which appliances get hot and not to touch them she knows not to touch knives or scissors can easily stay in the kitchen for long stretches of time because she *wants* to be there the other morning she whisked eggs while was cutting peppers do this too keep my month old gated in the kitchen with me while cook and encourage him to help by banging on pots and pans with an extra spatula or wooden spoon or something he also huge fan of still wrapped granola bars crinkly and tupperware also give him tastes of things whenever possible since he pretty adventurous eater and the little surprise snacks keep him happy have an older model of that and it is awesome my son loves it the new models are even better than the one have since mine does swivel or have replaceable toys but my ds8mo loves loves loves his just let her roam close the doors to the bathrooms and the rest of the apartment is baby proofed she has at least couple of toys in every room so she just wanders around and plays this thing http www amazon com graco bumper jumper little jungle dp b000wjlkqm ref=sr ie=utf8 amp qid=1348204194 amp sr=8 amp keywords=jumper was the best purchase have ever made hung it in the door between the kitchen and the living room awesome the consignment store yep maybe it was because lived in rather expensive area all consignment stores were expensive there in addition to other methods of distraction like the pantry full of baby safe stuff that is not baby toys change how cook when have little kid around cook in rice cooker aroma from costco that has cooking function and just cook things in there make japanese curry pork chops chicken stuff can brown and then add liquid to for the last bit of cooking ll also get more microwave sides so just cooking meat the aroma rice cooker is amazing for this never burns anything though this one is pretty crappy at rice have better cooker that use for rice are you from boston cook on sundays while my husband watches them and freeze for the rest of the week 14m old twins also have gate instead of kitchen door and sometimes can spend about 30min in the kitchen while they walk around and sometimes stop to say hi by the gate but as it not always possible rather just cook on sundays let it be noted that do work so it not big deal for me to spend whole day in the kitchen have month old who is able to entertain herself in spurts bonus points if she can see me try to do cooking in segments prep play with baby get longest cooking item started cooking and finish prep play with baby get everything else cooking play with baby then if things need stirred or whatever can usually do that one handed it long process but definitely worth it to feel like do need some one else around to feed myself lol put my son in the highchair in the kitchen with me and give him toys or green bean to chew on he also loves to play in the tupperware cupboard so let him do that deleted exercsaucer hmm the kid babysat for at that age would sit in his high chair for me he had an attachment on it that was like mini play gym and made noise and he was super into the toy the kid cried when took him out of the chair are there any toys he will play with while in the chair also would talk to the baby and he liked that if your carrier is causing you neck back shoulder pain then you need different carrier *source* have chronic pain and can still wear my baby in carrier for extended periods of time without increasing my pain agreed my son gets the tupperware cabinet to himself yeah he makes mess of it but it entertains him while get some stuff done my son is 19 months gave up cooking dinners that take that long because he just whines and clings to me for attention now just throw some meat and potatoes in the slow cooker before work and its done when everybody gets home my son is 18 months old now so he okay on his own or in the kitchen but have decent sized kitchen so he does really get underfoot or anything however he especially loves it when give him one of the old pots and spoon to bang on it or let him bring his dump truck in to drive around while flitting around cooking dinner oddly ve found it easier to get things like this done after he started walking and being mobile all over the place love that you call it baby jail that adorable baby prison love it we do the same thing we call it the cage have to be very careful where use that term was in the pediatrician office for his month appointment and mentioned that he was trying to climb out of his cage already the nurse stopped what she was doing and gave me that look of continue to explain yourself quickly said that we have baby fence and we call it the cage put my son now months in high chair and bring him over to where cooking explain to him what doing and bring things to him to taste smell and touch also start give him his dinner at that point finger foods as it keeps his attention sometimes he eats it sometimes he just plays with it either way he is occupied for while you said your son does like to sit in the chair try having him sit for longer periods over the course of week also try giving him toy or wooden spoon from the kitchen my son always loves to check out new things have found doing it this way making cooking take little longer but can keep him happy and get dinner done at the same time my store always has of them at any one time prob supply and demand pricing nope cali that amazing had no idea they could get invoked so young am inspired now thanks it really fun to see how excited she is about cooking and baking it gets messy sometimes but that part of the fun with my month old wear mine on my back in the ergo carrier it does hurt my shoulders or back ll also let her go through the pots and pans cabinet and give her wooden spoon my year old helps me by sitting on the counter and passing me stuff also meal plan and once every days do the prep for each nightly meal so cutting up veg portioning etc things that can easily grab one handed if needed try to cook at least one or meals that will last for week or two once week cook casserole ie lasagne and prep one slow cooker meal that gets cooked on monday when we work all day we eat the first days and freeze the rest then on night when one of us is late we just pop something in the oven and walk away other than that we have the tupperware cupboard as well if going to cook fill it up with toys in old cereal boxes or treats that my little one can easily access but has to work for always rotate toys and books so if book toy has been hidden from my girl for month or so throw it into the tupperware get good hours out of toys she had forever but has seen in while and every once in while add something new part of the game is also clean up she not allowed to whinge until she picked everything up deleted agreed have fibromyalgia and can comfortably back carry my 26lb 14 month old without pain front carries get uncomfortable once you have bigger kid use kinderpack and would recommend them they can be bought little cheaper used but even new they are worth their price well hello fellow babywearing fibromite had to stop the front carries at about 15lbs but ll sling my girls on my back all the time have boba and love it but love my wraps so usually leave the boba for my husband hi really should try wrap some time started out with an ergo which did fit me very well especially when started back carrying so then bought kinderpack with plus size straps and it been much better ve heard wraps are even more comfortable little intimidated by the thought of them though since still need help getting my son into back carry ve been meaning to go to meeting for the local babywearing group so might be able to get some help figuring out the back carrying when alone plus they have lending library of carriers and wraps to try the groups are great way to test things out if the wraps end up not working for you wrap strap mei tai is great middle ground
